newsitem.title: ESTONIA: THREE BIDDERS CHOSEN FOR ESTONIAN SHIPPING.
newsitem.headline: THREE BIDDERS CHOSEN FOR ESTONIAN SHIPPING.

text.p: The Estonian Privatisation Agency (EPA) on Wednesday said that it has chosen three bidders to privatise the Estonian Shipping company.
The three chosen were Arbonale, Baltic Cresco and Esco Holdings, Economics Minister Jaak Leimann told a news conference.
Leimann said the last date for proposals will be May 29 1997 and he hoped that an agreement would be signed by July 10, 1997.
Arbonale is formed by Jinhui Shipping and Transport Ltd, Nomura and Hansa Investments.
The Baltic Cresco group is a financial consortium and the Esco group has been formed by Swedish Carnegie AB and Esco Holdings.
An EPA official said that the three bidders were chosen on the basis of the backgriound of the consortium, their field activities, financial position and their business plan for Estonian Shipping.
